intro: Schoepfia chrysophylloides, commonly known as the golden-leaf schoepfia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Schoepfia chrysophylloides is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
